testCases.explanation: Starting at (1,1) with value 1, flood fill replaces all connected 1s with 2. The isolated 1 at (2,2) is not 4-directionally connected.
The new color (0) is the same as the starting cell's color (0), so no change is made.
The new color (1) equals the original color (1), so the image remains unchanged.
Starting at (0,0), all 4-directionally connected cells with value 1 get filled with 3. The isolated 1 at (2,2) remains.
Single cell grid: the only cell gets filled with color 5.

description: Given an image represented as a 2D integer grid, perform a flood fill starting from pixel (sr, sc) with the given color. Replace the color of the starting pixel and all 4-directionally connected pixels of the same original color with the new color.
